title: Reading Weather Signs from Animal Behavior
brief: How to predict weather changes by observing bird and insect behavior patterns.
steps: Step 1: Observe the flight patterns of birds and insects in your area.
Step 2: Note if they are flying lower to the ground than usual - this indicates heavy, moisture-laden air and likely rain.
Step 3: Watch for increased insect activity, which typically occurs before storms.
Step 4: Exception: Increased bee activity indicates fair weather approaching.
Step 5: Combine these observations with other weather signs for better prediction accuracy.
warnings: Animal behavior can be affected by factors other than weather.
Don't rely solely on animal signs - use multiple weather indicators together.
